alert.note: Alert for Collier; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 12:43PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southwest Florida, including the following counties, in Florida, Mainland Monroe. In southwest Florida, Collier. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1241 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from these slow moving thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with these slow moving thunderstorms during the next couple of hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If these rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Everglades City, Chokoloskee, Plantation Island, Carnestown, Big Cypress National Preserve and Everglades National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
